result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Geovanny Hernandez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Discharge Upon Expiration of Commitment; signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to Mendota Mental Health Institute on this date.

Attorney Paige Aleece Styler in court, defendant Geovanny Hernandez not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant appears by video teleconference.
Hearing commenced.  Sworn and testified for the State:  Dr. Erik Knudson who appeared by video teleconference.
Sworn and testified for the defense:  Geovanny Hernandez.  State rests.  Defense counsel rests.  Arguments to the Court.
Court finds that treatment has a therapeutic value, that defendant needs treatment and medication, that defendant is not competent to refuse medication, and that medication needs to be administered.
Therefore, the Court orders involuntary administration of medication and/or treatment.  Order for Involuntary Medication and Treatment signed by the Court and filed.  Copies provided to the State and defense counsel.  Copy to be mailed to facility.
Clerk:  jms
from Dr. Erik D Knudson dated 7/27/15, received and filed.
-Dismissing Petition For Conditional Release; received, filed and signed by the Court on April 22, 2015; Copies distributed to parties.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

Stipulation and Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits; filed.
for Placement (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect); signed and filed.
of Commitment (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect); signed and filed.

Defendant Geovanny Hernandez in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Geovanny Hernandez in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO PHASE III:  
Court finds that conditional release would pose a significant risk of bodily harm to the defendant or others and, therefore, ORDERED defendant committed for a term not more than 1 year 6 months to a DHS appropriate facility, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  Commitment commences forthwith.  Defendant to be transferred to a DHS mental institution/facility upon bed availability.  
Defendant is REMANDED for placement at a DHS appropriate facility.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court "administratively" ordered Defendant to receive credit of 85 days for time served.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

FILED, Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant Geovanny Hernandez in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Geovanny Hernandez in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO PHASE II:  
Court examined defendant as to his right to a jury trial.
Court ACCEPTS defendant's waiver of his right to a jury trial.
Parties stipulate to Dr. Collins' findings.
Court ACCEPTS the parties' stipulation to Dr. Collins' findings.
Exhibit #1 entered and received.
Based upon the greater weight of the credible evidence, Court finds defendant NOT GUILTY BY REASON OF MENTAL DISEASE OR DEFECT.

Defendant Geovanny Hernandez in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Geovanny Hernandez in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for an NGI Court Trial.

AS TO PHASE I OF SPECIAL PLEA:  
AS TO COUNT 1:  
   Defendant changes plea to "NO CONTEST". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form WITHOUT Addendum.
Invoice forwarded to A/P in the amount of $562.50 to Dr.Collins for services on 10-21-14, 10-24-14.Copy in file.

Attorney Barbara K Due in court, defendant Geovanny Hernandez not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for return on doctor's NGI report.
The doctor's report supports the NGI special plea.
Parties request a Court Trial date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 12-17-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for NGI Court Trial.
NGI Report as to the defendant prepared by psychologist, Dr. Deborah Collins - filed.
for Examination Under Sec. 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect); signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit for processing.

Defendant Geovanny Hernandez in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Geovanny Hernandez in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense counsel entered a special plea of not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect on behalf of her client. 
Court ACCEPTS special plea.
Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit as to the special plea. 
**Special request for Dr. Deborah Collins to complete the NGI evaluation.

Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 2, Judge Donald's Court on 10-29-2014 at 8:30 AM.

Bail remains the same.

FILED, signed Order For Examination under 971.16. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report/Status Update; received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Updated" Report; received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.  (Missed office contact.)

Defendant Geovanny Hernandez in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties not ready to proceed with a Projected Plea Hearing/DPA.
Parties still working out the details of DPA.
Case adjourned to 09-24-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Projected Plea Hearing/DPA.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Services.

Defendant Geovanny Hernandez in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties are still working out the details for a Deferred Prosecution Agreement (DPA).
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 08-25-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Projected Plea Hearing/DPA.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Geovanny Hernandez in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Projected Plea Hearing date for a possible DPA.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 07-24-2014 at 07-24-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing/DPA.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Geovanny Hernandez in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Denis Stingl for Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 6/4/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with James C.

Defendant Geovanny Hernandez in court with attorney R G Johnson.  Defendant Geovanny Hernandez in custody.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Geovanny Hernandez not in court. Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4/24/14 @ 1:30pm
